column4: I can't get my machine to suspend or hibernate (fresh install of natty). I've been looking at launchpad bug-reports and the forums.
A lot of users are having the same issue, but no solutions yet
is your swap at least the size of your ram
to be exact: my swap is 9gb and i have 4gb of ram
how do i check the changes to the kernel though? and what can i do about it?
Viliny if i had the hardware i could troubleshoot it, but I dont :(
yeah but Id loose it on suspend lol
i would start be figuring out what has changed in the kernel
that's the thing. I can get suspend and hibernate functionality back by using a rather old kernel (2.6.35) but then the touchpad doesn't work the way it should
first check the version numbers, and read the change logs for anything acpi related, thencheck the new kernel to see what the configuration is like.
but that's like...30 changelogs!
debugging is not easy
but just think of all the glory! youd be a launchpad hero
maybe we will luck out and my mom's new laptop will suffer from that problem
get her a dell!
I think your mom would love a dell studio 1747
that core i7 processor is just what she needs
no this is a acer, older model on clearance
but your right my mom would love that dell lappy, so long as it has a numberpad
it does, and a 17 inch monitor
